plot outline: A trip of a bank manager to a resort was spoiled when he came to know that the rest house booked by him was already given to somebody else. Later he, along with his family, remains in the servant's house and they plan to spoil the holidays of those who have spoiled their holidays. His son falls in love with the daughter of the person living in the rest house.
title: Kabhie Tum Kabhie Hum
akas: Sometimes You Sometimes Us (India, English title)
distributors: National Film Development Corporation of India
plot: A trip of a bank manager to a resort was spoiled when he came to know that the rest house booked by him was already given to somebody else. Later he, along with his family, remains in the servant's house and they plan to spoil the holidays of those who have spoiled their holidays. His son falls in love with the daughter of the person living in the rest house.::Mohsin Ali Khan

Dinanath Shastri is a bank manager for 17 years, and has never taken his family, (wife, and two sons), for a vacation. He decides to treat his family to a vacation in Panchwati, and books the bank's guest house for that purpose. During the last days at the bank, he turns down a loan application from Mr. Shrivastav, which causes a lot of anger. Ironically, the "easily swayed" care-taker at the guest house has already rented the guest house to Mr. Shrivastav and his family, (wife, a daughter and one son) for a "fee". At the arrival of the Shastri family at the guest house, Dinanath is enraged, and instead of returning to the city to file a formal complaint, decides to stay on and make the holiday of the Shrivastav a virtual nightmare. In the meantime, Shrivastav also finds out that it is the very same manager who had turned his loan application, and he too is determined to make their holiday miserable. Chaos and comedy result as the two families confront each other.::rAjOo (gunwanti@hotmail.com)
